title: Have we surpassed a point in which all objectivity has been lost, arrived at a point in time in which all must succumb to one ideology on the left or right disregarding centrists, and is there no point of return to the so-called 'normalcy'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Have we surpassed a point in which all objectivity has been lost, arrived at a point in time in which all must succumb to one ideology on the left or right disregarding centrists, and is there no point of return to the so-called "normalcy"? Good golly. No, we haven’t passed that point. Some people sure seem to have lost perspective, though. Questioner. We are all free to find and value our own goods (“values”), and to rank and order them by importance (“priorities”). No one can possibly make us devalue (in us) the known good we’ve found again and again in proven experience. How could they? We know the good of it. No one can make us value what they value. All they can do is present it to us, best the case they can. All they can do is make an appeal to human reason for something they believe we, too can see. But they lay it before our judgment. Our judgment shall decide what it’s worth to us. We don’t have to agree. That covers subjectivity: what-is-good and what-should-be. Almost everything of human worth and importance comes under subjectivity. Objectivity deals solely in what-is. It’s trivial, but important to be able to discern and assess, and work with. It’s pretty easy. Whatever truth claim someone offers, if it intersects with your life at all you are readily able to assess its truth value by comparison with observable reality. As some call it, “objective reality.” “Objective” here just means existence independent of any given person’s perception or perspective. Objectivity isn’t remotely lost. We’re fully-immersed and swimming in it, constantly. It’s right there for the touching, for direct sample and observation, the scrutiny, the repeatable test. For comparison with truth claims. True, some people avert their eyes, deny and ignore - but they’re free to! That’s powerfully maladaptive behavior, though. The kind of person you’re talking about, who feels they must succumb to ideologies - it sounds to me like they never learned to separate their own worth from what other people think. They feel they have to subscribe to some mass deal just to fit in, regardless of what they can see for themselves, or what they know the good of. Well, they’re free to! That’s powerfully maladaptive behavior, though. That kind of attitude is opt-in. You do it because you’ve passed some point, not because we have.

Not at all — this election is super close, and we’re all waiting for the centrists to show up. People who take reality seriously, who read newspapers and don’t just get their news from social media [cough.] How many centrists are working on “Get Out The Vote” campaigns? How many centrists are digging in deep and actually reading, idk, let’s say the Mueller Report, actually reading it rather than listening to soundbites. Or any of the other controversies, digging in deep to see who actually is lying? In the US, the center is not defeated, it is missing. Find ways to focus, pick an issue or two, get other friends who wish for objectivity and normalcy, and dig deep. Centrists have to reward honesty and objectivity, or the system is just left-vs-right with no referee. False-equivalence where you pretend both sides are at fault no matter what they do just encourages bad behavior by the partisans. As soon as the centrists can get 5% or 10% of the vote — like volunteer on Get Out The Vote, volunteer as hard as the partisans, or even just volunteer 10% as hard as the partisans — then centrists will decide national elections. Pick an issue or maybe two, and dig really deep — read newspapers, even books, figure out who is lying to you. Then move your friends to vote with ethics, put time into getting them all to vote.

In a sense we have. Academia and journalism to an overwhelming extent are both dictated by “post-modernist” principles. One of the hallmarks of post-modernism is the rejection of objectivity or objective truth which can be reasoned out and replicated through experimentation. Notice how we are constantly told things as fact which contradict evidence but by perception they are “subjectively” true (think how often you hear “my truth” as opposed to “THE truth”). Until we can agree that certain things are true based on observability and replication and reject post-modernism we will never return to “normalcy” where rationalism and logic rule.
